column4: hello room - I recently reinstalled 10.10 and found that my system no longer recognizes my usb thumb drive
any ideas on how to fix?
does,' lsusb ' in the terminal show the drive when connected
lsusb notes the presence of the drive
look at the lsusb  output for lsusb of the drive and try this : sudo mount -o remount,rw /path/to/drive
the lsusb output for the drive is very long - which/what would the 'drive' look like?
could you pastebin the output of lsusb
it should be listed in /media in nautilus
- the only things listed in my /media are an external drive and a DVD that happens to be in THAT drive - no Toshiba stick
